details.title: Voting begins across 59 constituencies
details.content: Voting begins for 59 parliamentary constituencies in the 6th phase of polling across Bihar, Haryana, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Jharkhand and Delhi.

details.title: All seven seats in Delhi are going to polls today
details.content:
Delhi: People queue up to vote at polling booth number 124 in Civil Lines(Chandni Chowk constituency) #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/3bJAf2k8xG

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2019

details.title: BJP worker found dead in Bengal
details.content: BJP worker Raman Singh found dead last night in Gopiballabpur, Jhargram. (ANI)

details.title: Indian cricket Captain Virat Kohli was among the early voters in Haryana
Hindutva and development are synonymous: Sadhvi Pragya Thakur
details.content:
In an interview with Express, Pragya Thakur said that Hindutva and development are synonymous. Arrested in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, she was given a clean chit by the National Investigation Agency (NIA), but the trial court refused to discharge her from the case.

READ THE INTERVIEW HERE

details.title: Voting yet to begin in some parts of Bengal
details.content: In West Bengal's Bankura, owing to EVM malfunction, voting is yet to begin in multiple polling booths.

details.title: PM Modi urges youngsters to vote in record numbers
details.content:
Yet another phase of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections is here!

Urging all those whose constituencies are polling in today’s sixth phase to go out and vote. I hope youngsters are voting in record numbers. After all, their participation makes the polls even more special.

— Chowkidar Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) May 12, 2019

details.title: Two more Bengal BJP workers shot at in East Medinipur
details.content: Two BJP workers Ananta Guchait & Ranjit Maity shot at last night in Bhagabanpur, East Medinipur. Both the injured admitted to hospital.(ANI)

details.title: Brisk voting in UP's Sultanpur
details.content: Brisk voting seen in the early hours in Sultanpur where Union Social Welfare minister Maneka Gandhi is trying her luck against Chandrabhadra Singh of gathbandhan and Dr Sanjay Singh of Congress.

details.title: Poll officer suspended for carrying reserve EVM to his residence in MP's Guna
details.content: Sector assistant engineer, AK Shrivastav was suspended for allegedly carrying the reserve EVM to his residence here. "The EVM has been seized and the officer has been suspended, further action will be taken on instructions of the higher-ups," SDM, Shivani Rakwar Garg told media on Saturday.

details.title: 10 per cent polling in Delhi so far
details.content: 10 per cent polling recorded in national capital till 9 am.

details.title: Voter turnout till 9 am
details.content: Voting percentage till 9 am: Bihar-9.03, Haryana- 3.74, Madhya Pradesh- 4.01, Uttar Pradesh- 6.86, West Bengal- 6.58, Jharkhand- 12.45.

details.title: Polling officer injured in accidental firing in Bihar
details.content:
In an accidental firing, a polling officer, deputed at 275 number polling booth in Bihar's Sheohar district, sustained a critical bullet injury, early Sunday morning. Official sources said Shivendra Kumar, assistant teacher in Sitamarhi,was made the polling officer.

"The incident took place in course of careless handling of arms by a constable on duty," official sorurces said, adding that the injured was immediatly rushed to a nearby private clinic.

details.title: Manohar Lal Khattar casts his vote
details.content:
Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar casts his vote at a polling booth in Karnal. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/dd0wqIGb6b

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2019

details.title: Slow polling recorded in Madhya Pradesh
details.content: Maximum 15 per cent in Rajgarh and minimum 4per cent in Gwalior polling was reported till 9 am. In, Bhopal around 9.5 per cent and 6 per cent polling from Guna was recorded.

details.title: Manohar Lal Khattar today travelled by train to cast his vote
details.content: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar today morning travelled by Shatabdi Express train from Chandigarh to his hometown Karnal to cast his vote.

details.title: Elderly voter collapses to death in Bihar
details.content: A voter, aged about 65, died after casting his vote at Pipra kothi booth number 262 in Motihari.

details.title: North-East Delhi candidate Manoj Tiwari casts his vote
details.content:
Delhi BJP Chief & party's candidate from North-East Delhi Manoj Tiwari casts his vote at polling booth number 60 in Yamuna Vihar. He is up against Congress's Sheila Dikshit and AAP's Dilip Pandey. #LokSabhaElections2019 #Phase6 pic.twitter.com/4NWJ8ZO24e

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2019

details.title: Congress president Rahul Gandhi after casting his vote at a polling station

details.title: Narendra Modi used hatred in the campaign and we used love: Rahul
details.content: "The election was fought on key issues including demonetization, farmer problems, Gabbar Singh Tax and corruption in Rafale. Narendra Modi used hatred in the campaign and we used love and I am confident love will win," said Rahul Gandhi.

details.title: Akhilesh Yadav alleges EVM malfunctioning in Azamgarh
details.content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged that EVM were not functioning properly in Azamgarh. The party had complained to the Election Commission about district authorities helping the BJP.

details.title: WATCH| UPA government will come to power and with new ideas, says Jyotiraditya Scindia
Dilip Ghosh alleges TMC intimidation on his men
details.content: Bengal BJP Chief Dilip Ghosh- At a booth in Rampura, my people were being threatened since yesterday so I went to meet. TMC goons attacked us, we were stopped from going inside the booth. These people are stopping people from voting.

details.title: We are fighting to save democracy: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra
details.content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra after casting her vote in Delhi: It's a really important election because we are fighting to save democracy, for our country, and keeping that in mind I cast my vote.

details.title: In Bhind, candidates kept confined to home
details.content:
In Bhind Lok Sabha constituency, Congress candidate Devashish Jarariya, BJP candidate Sandhya Rai and BSP candidate Babulal Jamore have been confined to their house due to security reasons.

BJP MLA Arvind Bhadauria and Cong MLA Hemant Katare are also under close surveillance at their house to prevent any untoward incident.

details.title: 34.92 per cent polling recorded in Uttar Pradesh till 1pm
details.content: The Sultanpur constituency recorded the highest number of turnout at 38.87 per cent whereas Phulpur recorded the lowest at 29.2 per cent.

details.title: AAP candidate Raghav Chadha alleges rigging at a polling booth in Tughlakabad
details.content:
Massive rigging and bogus voting incidents reported at Govt Boys Sr Sec School in Tughlakabad. Our volunteers have again unearthed the fraud. Election officers and Police are in connivance with BJP. I am reaching the spot.

— Raghav Chadha (@raghav_chadha) May 12, 2019

details.title: Three suspicious vehicles seized in Rohtak
details.content:
The police caught three vehicles bearing temporary registration number in front of Vishwakarma School in the 62-Rohtak assembly constituency of the Rohtak parliamentary area.

Sources said that 15 cartridges of 32 bore, two wooden sticks and two number plates bearing different registration numbers have been recovered from these vehicles. Two persons identified as Sunil, a resident of village Makdouli and Ramesh, from Bohar village have been arrested along with these vehicles.

details.title: Haryana registered 31.53 per cent voting until 1 pm.
details.content: Congress leader Deepender Hooda accused Haryana Minister of State for Cooperatives Manish Kumar Grover of booth capturing in Rohtak. Meanwhile, Haryana registered 31.53 per cent voting until 1 pm.

details.title: 'BJP indulging in bogus voting'
details.content:
AAP South Delhi candidate Raghav Chadha: BJP workers are moving around in a polling booth in Sangam Vihar in BJP scarves, a person voted 4 times. We identified 8-10 such ppl and caught one red handed. Ramesh Bidhuri(BJP candidate) is losing badly so is indulging in such tactics pic.twitter.com/OR8LKqbyeQ

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2019
Former President Pranab Mukherjee casts his vote at a polling booth in NP Primary School, K Kamraj Lane.

details.title: Don't allow outsiders in Lok Sabha constituencies, 48 hours before the elections: Naqvi
details.content: Have demanded that outsiders be not allowed in Lok Sabha constituencies, 48 hours before the elections, and that history-sheeters be arrested. Our candidate Bharati Ghosh's car was stopped, have demanded action against the officers involved: Union minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi

details.title: Cash-for-vote in Bihar: Motihari police apprehend youth
details.content:
The district police of East Champaran at Motihari in Bihar apprehended a youth identified as Manoj Gupta for allegedly influencing the voters with cash in favour of a particular candidate near to the polling booth. He was taken to the local police station by a team of police officials.

Sources said Gupta had some amount of cash in his possession that couldn't be disclosed till the releasing of this report.

In another incident, the Motihari police seized an SUV belonging to Dhakha RJD MLA Faisal Rahman when he was escaping after having an alleged exchange of words with some electorates at Jamuna nagar booths 261 and 262.

details.title: Vice-president, wife vote in the 6th phase
details.content:
Delhi: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu and his wife Usha after casting their votes at Nirman Bhawan polling booth. pic.twitter.com/focF73Xppi

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2019
AAP party west Delhi candidate Balbir Singh Jakhar after cast his vote at a polling station in New Delhi on Sunday. (Photo | EPS)

details.title: BJP candidate alleges mob attack in Narkatia assembly segment of Bihar
details.content: An unruly mob armed with of lathis reportedly attacked BJP candidate from Bettiah Dr Sanjay Jaiswal at Narkatia assembly segment. The police have taken Jaiswal, sitting MP of Bettiah, under protection and rushed additional police forces at the spot, The incident took place near booths 162 and 163 where Jaiswal had gone on rounds during polling. Bettiah is district hw.of West champaran and gunshots were heard also from booths, reports Bihar correspondent Rajesh Kumar Thakur.

details.title: I would have been lynched: Sanjay Jaiswal
details.content: On speaking to Express, Jaiswal said that when he went to booths after being informed that voters of particular castes were prevented from voting. "Had my security guards not opened fired, I would have been lynched till now," he alleged.

details.title: Tilak Nagar youths allege political parties used anti-Sikh riots to get votes
details.content:
Political parties have used 1984 riots to get our votes. We have decided to not cast votes: youths at Tilak Nagar #WestDelhi @NewIndianXpress @TheMornStandard pic.twitter.com/ehsHsVX0re

— Ritwika Mitra (@MRitwika) May 12, 2019

details.title: Priyanka Gandhi's first-time voter son misses voting
details.content:
Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Robert Vadra's 19-year-old son Rehan, a first-time voter, was conspicuous by his absence on Sunday as his parents came out to vote in the sixth phase of polling in Delhi. "Rehan cannot vote today as he has gone to London," Priyanka told reporters.

[READ FULL REPORT]

Congress leader Digvijay Singh on Sunday expressed regret over not being able to cast his ballot in Rajgarh district of Madhya Pradesh, which is over 130 km away from state capital Bhopal where he is locked in a key contest with BJP candidate Pragya Singh Thakur. [READ FULL REPORT]

details.title: Repolling in byelection to Kamaraj Nagar assembly segment
details.content: Re-polling in the by-election to the Kamaraj Nagar Assembly segment in Pondicherry saw a voter turnout of 55.35 percent, poll officials said Sunday. Of the total 952 voters, 527 electors including 265 women exercised their franchise, reported PTI.
